title: Zelensky calls on UN Security Council to strip Moscow of its veto power
description: Ukraine's president accused Russia of waging a 'criminal and unprovoked aggression' that undermines all norms of war and the UN charter Wednesday at a meeting of the UN Security Council.

title: Champions League: Bayern Munich defeats Manchester United as Arsenal crushes PSV
description: In other Champions League fixtures on Wednesday, Napoli and Real Madrid both came away with narrow last-minute victories while Lens and Sevilla tied at the Ramon Sanchez-Pizjuan Stadium.

title: French journalist released after arrest for reporting on France's role in Egyptian spy operation
description: Ariane Lavrilleux was detained for two days following her coverage of leaked documents alleging French intelligence involvement in targeting civilians in Egypt, a move that raised concerns among human rights organizations.

title: Red carpet, Arc de Triomphe, Patrouille de France: Photos from Charles III's first day in France
description: After their state visit scheduled for March was postponed because of unrest, King Charles III and Queen Camilla are visiting France from Wednesday to Friday.

title: Charles III urges the reinvigoration of Franco-British relations at Versailles dinner
description: Amidst a glittering banquet at the Palace of Versailles, King Charles III and President Emmanuel Macron both emphasized a shared commitment to addressing common challenges in the modern era.

title: US election: 'What risks further weakening Joe Biden, is none other than Joe Biden himself'
description: In the coming presidential campaign, Biden will face two obstacles: his age and his desire to assert the federal government's role when voters expected a peacemaker above all, writes Gilles Paris.

title: Rugby World Cup: Italy bounces back to beat Uruguay 38-17
description: After a shaky first half, Italy regained its composure to easily dominate Uruguay in their Pool A match.

title: Sunak pushes UK's new petrol and diesel car ban back to 2035 in major U-turn
description: Originally due to take force in 2030, the deadline has now been delayed by five years, a move that has angered both climate activists and car manufacturers.

title: Video: King Charles III's Paris visit
description: The British royals arrived in France on Wednesday for a three-day state visit.

title: Charlotte opens Maison Gainsbourg to honor her father's glory
description: Opening the Paris apartment where her father lived to the public is a project Charlotte Gainsbourg has been working on since his death, in 1991. Starting on September 20, visitors will be able to tour the home where she grew up and visit the museum across the street, where a collection of objects belonging to the musician will be on display.

title: US opioid crisis: 'Overdoses are among the leading causes of death in several age categories'
description: Epidemiologist Chelsea Shover discusses a new report about the recent findings on the opioid scourge that's ravaging the United States, more than two decades after the first wave of opioid deaths.

title: The obstacles lining the road to normalization of Israeli-Saudi Arabia relations
description: The United States is working hard to convince its two main allies in the Middle East to establish formal diplomatic relations. But the negotiations, which intensified over the summer, are encountering numerous hurdles.

title: Azerbaijan's military offensive in Nagorno-Karabakh
description: Nagorno-Karabakh, a separatist enclave in Azerbaijan with an Armenian majority, has already seen two wars between Yerevan and Baku, the last of which lasted six weeks.

title: FBI investigates poisoning of Russian activist in Prague
description: The attack on Natalia Arno, president of the Free Russia Foundation, is one in a long list of former Russian agents, opponents, and journalists targeted by nerve agents.

title: French secularism: 'The 2004 law banning religious symbols in schools was ambiguous from the outset'
description: The legislation has not prevented recent debates on abayas in France. This is due to a specific conception of secularism that is at odds with the legal precedent, writes legal expert Anne Fornerod.

title: Morocco earthquake: Reconstruction will be long and complex
description: Some 50,000 totally or partially collapsed homes are covered by the first version of the national disaster relief program, as authorities grapple with accessing remote, mountainous areas.

title: Azerbaijan halts Karabakh operation as separatists lay down arms
description: Baku and the ethnic-Armenian authorities in Karabakh said a deal was brokered by Russian peacekeepers over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh a day after Azerbaijan launched an 'anti-terrorist operation.'

title: French and German defense ministers: 'We should be glad to have stronger European armies'
description: Sébastien Lecornu and Boris Pistorius spoke to Le Monde about their own countries' and Europe's military priorities against the backdrop of the war in Ukraine and the situation in Niger.

title: Iran MPs vote to toughen penalties for women flouting dress code
description: Women failing to meet the guidelines of Iran's strict Islamic dress code could face years in jail under a new bill approved by lawmakers for a 3-year trial period.

title: In Derna, Libyan survivors are isolated and surrounded by death
description: Nine days after storm Daniel hit the Libyan city, bitterness and anger are spreading as the chances of finding survivors are now almost nonexistent.

title: French organic sector in rapid decline: 'Some producers no longer display the logo to avoid scaring customers'
description: Hard hit by inflation, sales at organic supermarkets in France plunged by 13% in the first half of the year.

title: Most Spanish women footballers rejoin squad after deal
description: The World Cup winners had left after the disgraced former president of the federation forcibly kissed a player. Two of the 23 called-up players did not wish to continue with the squad.

title: In Nagorno-Karabakh, Azerbaijan launches major offensive
description: Baku used enemy sabotage as a pretext to exploit its military advantage to destroy Armenian targets, against a backdrop of passivity on the part of Russian peacekeepers.

title: Helicopter pilot recounts coerced role in prison escape: 'They pointed guns at me'
description: Stéphane Buy told a Paris court how he was forcefully enrolled in the escape of bank robber Rédoine Faïd. He tried to clear up questions surrounding his account of the events.

title: King Charles III and Queen Camilla's visit to France: A busy itinerary to demonstrate French-British friendship
description: Postponed from March due to pension reform protests, the royals will visit France from Wednesday to Friday, with an itinerary closely mirroring their original plans.

title: How agribusiness is consuming Brazil's Cerrado savanna
description: Half of northeastern Brazil's ecosystem has been amputated to make way for pesticide-laden fields of soya, corn, sorghum and cotton. Its destruction and the hazardous drying out of its soil seem unstoppable.

title: The French Catholic far right is no longer holding back against Pope Francis
description: Ahead of the pope's visit to Marseille in southern France on September 22 and 23, Eric Zemmour and his supporters have launched a political offensive against the pontiff for his humanist approach to migrants.

title: French journalist taken into custody over revelations on France's military cooperation with Egypt
description: Ariane Lavrilleux, a journalist for Disclose who helped shed light on suspected civilian deaths in a French-Egyptian counter-terrorism operation by revealing secret documents in 2021, was taken in for questioning by police in the south of France.

title: Azerbaijan's bombardment of Nagorno-Karabakh illustrates waning of Moscow's influence
description: Whether through political calculation or a lack of military resources monopolized by the war in Ukraine, Moscow has abandoned its role as arbiter and guarantor in the Caucasus region.
